meanings.definition: A type of butterfly with long, pointed hindwings that resemble the tail of a swallow.
meanings.sent1: The swallowtail fluttered gracefully in the garden.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a swallowtail while hiking in the woods.
meanings.sent3: The swallowtail butterfly decided to take a break on a flower petal.
meanings.sent4: Her dress flowed behind her like a swallowtail in flight.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the swallowtail made it stand out among the flowers.

meanings.definition: A type of fastening on a garment that resembles the tail of a swallow.
meanings.sent1: She adjusted the swallowtail on her coat to keep it securely closed.
meanings.sent2: The vintage jacket had intricate swallowtail details.
meanings.sent3: The tailor added a unique swallowtail closure to the dress.
meanings.sent4: The swallowtail on the dress added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent5: The swallowtail fastening gave the coat a stylish finish.
